title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 43 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 43.

questions.question: From which direction did the glory of the God of Israel come in Ezekiel's vision?
questions.correctAnswer: East
questions.explanation: The glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east as described in Ezekiel 43:2.

questions.question: What sound was the voice of God compared to in Ezekiel 43:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Noise of many waters
questions.explanation: The voice of God was like a noise of many waters according to Ezekiel 43:2.

questions.question: Where did the glory of the LORD enter the house according to Ezekiel 43:4?
options: By the gate toward the east
By the gate toward the north
By the gate toward the south
By the gate toward the west
questions.correctAnswer: By the gate toward the east
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:4 states the glory of the LORD came into the house by the way of the gate whose prospect is toward the east.

questions.question: What happened when the spirit took Ezekiel into the inner court?
options: The glory of the LORD filled the house
questions.correctAnswer: The glory of the LORD filled the house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:5 says the spirit took Ezekiel into the inner court and the glory of the LORD filled the house.

questions.question: Who was standing by Ezekiel when he heard the voice speaking out of the house?
questions.correctAnswer: A man
questions.explanation: According to Ezekiel 43:6, a man stood by Ezekiel when he heard the voice speaking out of the house.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 43:7, what will the house of Israel no longer do to defile God's holy name?
options: Whoredom and carcases of their kings
questions.correctAnswer: Whoredom and carcases of their kings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:7 states that the house of Israel will no more defile God's holy name by their whoredom nor by the carcases of their kings.

questions.question: What caused God to consume the people in His anger according to Ezekiel 43:8?
options: Their abominations defiling His holy name
Their refusal to keep the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Their abominations defiling His holy name
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:8 explains that their abominations, which defiled God's holy name, caused God to consume them in anger.

questions.question: What did God say must be put away far from Him for Him to dwell among the people forever?
options: Whoredom and the carcases of their kings
questions.correctAnswer: Whoredom and the carcases of their kings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:9 says they must put away their whoredom and the carcases of their kings far from God for Him to dwell with them.

questions.question: What was Ezekiel commanded to show to the house of Israel so they might be ashamed of their iniquities?
questions.correctAnswer: The house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:10 commands Ezekiel to show the house to the house of Israel to make them ashamed of their iniquities.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 43:13, what measurement is used for the altar?
questions.correctAnswer: Cubit and hand breadth
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:13 states the altar's measurements are given in cubits and a hand breadth.

questions.question: What was the length and breadth of the altar as described in Ezekiel 43:16?
options: Twelve cubits long and twelve broad
Ten cubits long and ten broad
Four cubits long and four broad
Fourteen cubits long and fourteen broad
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve cubits long and twelve broad
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:16 describes the altar as twelve cubits long and twelve cubits broad, square in four squares.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 43:17, the altar's stairs shall look toward the west.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:17 states the altar's stairs shall look toward the east, not the west.

questions.question: True or False: Only priests from the seed of Zadok are given the young bullock for a sin offering according to Ezekiel 43:19.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:19 specifies that the priests who are Levites of the seed of Zadok receive the young bullock for a sin offering.

questions.question: True or False: The priests were commanded to cast salt upon the burnt offerings as described in Ezekiel 43:24.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:24 instructs that the priests shall cast salt upon the burnt offerings.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Ezekiel 43:25: 'Seven days shalt thou prepare every day a goat for a ______ offering.'
questions.correctAnswer: sin
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:25 states that every day for seven days, a goat for a sin offering shall be prepared.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 43 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feeling distant from God's presence. Based on Ezekiel 43, what biblical truth would you share to encourage their trust in God?
options: God's glory will return and fill His house when His people turn away from sin
God only dwells with perfect people
God's presence is unpredictable and distant
God no longer dwells among His people
questions.correctAnswer: God's glory will return and fill His house when His people turn away from sin
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:4-5, 7-9 show that when Israel puts away their sins, God's glory returns and fills the house, promising His presence among His people forever.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 43 teach us about obedience and reverence in worship?
options: We must follow God's detailed ordinances and laws for worship carefully
Worship is only about personal feelings
Ordinances are optional and can be changed
God prefers spontaneous worship without rules
questions.correctAnswer: We must follow God's detailed ordinances and laws for worship carefully
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:10-11, 18 emphasize showing the house's pattern and obeying all ordinances and laws, highlighting the importance of reverence and obedience in worship.

questions.question: A Christian parent wants to teach their children humility and repentance. What lesson from Ezekiel 43 would you share?
options: Recognizing and being ashamed of sin leads to restoration with God
Ignoring sin will make God happy
Pride is a sign of spiritual maturity
Repentance is unnecessary if you pray
questions.correctAnswer: Recognizing and being ashamed of sin leads to restoration with God
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:10-11 teaches that showing the house to Israel is to make them ashamed of their iniquities, leading them to keep God's laws and experience restoration.

questions.question: What practical advice does Ezekiel 43 offer about perseverance through trials and spiritual discipline?
options: Consistent cleansing and consecration over seven days purify the altar, symbolizing ongoing spiritual discipline
Spiritual discipline is only needed once
Trials mean God has abandoned you
You can ignore purification and still be accepted
questions.correctAnswer: Consistent cleansing and consecration over seven days purify the altar, symbolizing ongoing spiritual discipline
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:25-26 describes seven days of offerings and purging to consecrate the altar, illustrating the importance of perseverance and discipline in spiritual life.

questions.question: A believer is confused about the importance of holiness in their daily work. How does Ezekiel 43 instruct us regarding integrity and holiness?
options: Holiness must be maintained in all places, as the altar and house are most holy
Holiness applies only in church buildings
God does not require holiness in everyday activities
questions.correctAnswer: Holiness must be maintained in all places, as the altar and house are most holy
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:12 and 15-17 describe the altar and the whole mountain as most holy, teaching believers to maintain holiness and integrity in all areas of life.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 43 encourage generosity and stewardship in serving God?
options: The detailed offerings and sacrifices show a call to give faithfully and honor God
Stewardship is about keeping everything for yourself
questions.correctAnswer: The detailed offerings and sacrifices show a call to give faithfully and honor God
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:18-25 outlines specific offerings and sacrifices, symbolizing the importance of faithful giving and honoring God through stewardship.

questions.question: A church leader wants to teach about forgiveness and reconciliation. What does Ezekiel 43 reveal about turning from sin and God's acceptance?
options: God will dwell among His people if they put away wickedness and cleanse themselves
Forgiveness is not related to obedience
questions.correctAnswer: God will dwell among His people if they put away wickedness and cleanse themselves
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:9 and 27 promise God's dwelling among His people after they put away sin and purify themselves, highlighting forgiveness and reconciliation through repentance.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 43 teaches that God’s glory comes from the west and fills the temple from that direction.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:1-4 clearly states that the glory of the God of Israel comes from the east and enters by the gate facing east, not west.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 43, the priests must consecrate themselves before making offerings on the altar.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:26 states that during the seven days of purging the altar, the priests shall consecrate themselves, emphasizing the need for holiness before service.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ezekiel 43:7 says God will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel for ______.
questions.correctAnswer: ever
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:7 promises that God will dwell among the children of Israel forever, showing His eternal commitment to His people.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 43 teach about honesty and accountability in spiritual leadership?
options: Levitical priests of Zadok, who are faithful, are given responsibility to minister and offer sacrifices
Any person can lead without accountability
Spiritual leaders do not need to be pure
questions.correctAnswer: Levitical priests of Zadok, who are faithful, are given responsibility to minister and offer sacrifices
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:19 identifies the Levites of Zadok's seed as those who approach God faithfully to minister, highlighting the need for integrity in spiritual leadership.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to apply the concept of God's holiness in family life. What lesson from Ezekiel 43 could you share?
options: God's holiness requires setting apart places and actions from sin, which applies to family life as well
Family life is separate from holiness
God does not care about holiness at home
questions.correctAnswer: God's holiness requires setting apart places and actions from sin, which applies to family life as well
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:8-9 discuss defilement by sin and the need to put away wickedness so God can dwell among His people, teaching believers to maintain holiness in all areas including family.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 43 teach us about humility and contentment in following God's instructions?
options: Believers must carefully follow God's detailed instructions without adding or subtracting
We can change God's instructions to suit our preferences
Contentment comes from doing whatever feels right
questions.correctAnswer: Believers must carefully follow God's detailed instructions without adding or subtracting
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:10-11 emphasizes showing and writing the form and laws of the house so the people may keep all ordinances, teaching obedience and humility before God’s Word.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 43 encourage believers to handle temptation and sin in daily life?
options: By putting away whoredom and defilement, cleansing themselves to live in God's presence
By hiding sin and pretending it doesn't exist
By thinking sin is unavoidable and accepting it
questions.correctAnswer: By putting away whoredom and defilement, cleansing themselves to live in God's presence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:9 urges putting away sin far from God so He may dwell among them, teaching believers to resist temptation and pursue holiness.

questions.question: What practical lesson about faithfulness in service to God is taught in Ezekiel 43 regarding offerings?
options: Offerings must be without blemish and prepared carefully according to God's instructions
Offering anything is acceptable, regardless of condition
Service to God requires no preparation or care
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings must be without blemish and prepared carefully according to God's instructions
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:22-25 prescribes sin offerings without blemish and careful preparation, teaching faithfulness and reverence in serving God.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 43.

questions.question: From which direction did the glory of the God of Israel come as described in Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: From the east
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:2 states that the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east.

questions.question: What sound accompanied the glory of God coming from the east in Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: Noise of many waters
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:2 describes the voice of God as being like the noise of many waters.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 43, what action did the spirit take the prophet to witness the glory filling the house?
questions.correctAnswer: Into the inner court
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:5 says the spirit took the prophet into the inner court where the glory of the LORD filled the house.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 43, what is the significance of the place of God's throne and the soles of His feet?
options: Where God will dwell among Israel forever
The location of the high priest's seat
questions.correctAnswer: Where God will dwell among Israel forever
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:7 states that the place of God's throne and the soles of His feet is where He will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel forever.

questions.question: What caused God to consume the house of Israel in His anger as described in Ezekiel 43?
options: Defiling His holy name by abominations
Failing to build the altar correctly
questions.correctAnswer: Defiling His holy name by abominations
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:8 explains that Israel defiled God's holy name by their abominations, which led to His anger consuming them.

questions.question: What does God instruct the son of man to show the house of Israel to make them ashamed of their iniquities?
questions.correctAnswer: The pattern of the house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:10 commands the son of man to show the house to Israel so they may be ashamed and measure the pattern.

questions.question: What is the purpose of writing the form, ordinances, and laws of the house in the sight of the house of Israel according to Ezekiel 43?
options: So they may keep and do them faithfully
To preserve them for future generations
To compare with other nations' laws
To use them in legal disputes
questions.correctAnswer: So they may keep and do them faithfully
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:11 explains that the laws and ordinances are written to ensure the Israelites keep the whole form and ordinances and do them.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 43, what is the measurement of the altar's length and breadth?
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve cubits by twelve cubits
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:16 states that the altar shall be twelve cubits long and twelve cubits broad, square in four squares.

questions.question: What feature of the altar is described as looking toward the east in Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: The stairs
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:17 specifies that the stairs of the altar shall look toward the east.

questions.question: Who are the priests specifically mentioned in Ezekiel 43 as those who shall minister at the altar?
options: Levites of the seed of Zadok
questions.correctAnswer: Levites of the seed of Zadok
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:19 directs that the priests who are Levites of the seed of Zadok are those who shall approach to minister.

questions.question: What ritual action involving the bullock's blood is commanded for cleansing the altar in Ezekiel 43?
options: Put blood on the four horns and four corners
Pour blood at the base of the altar
Anoint the altar with oil and blood
questions.correctAnswer: Put blood on the four horns and four corners
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:20 instructs to put the bullock's blood on the four horns, four corners of the settle, and the border round about to cleanse and purge the altar.

questions.question: How many days shall the priests prepare sin offerings and purify the altar according to Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:25-26 commands seven days to prepare a goat for sin offering and to purge and purify the altar.

questions.question: On which day do the priests begin making burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar according to Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: The eighth day
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:27 states that on the eighth day and onward, the priests shall make burnt and peace offerings on the altar.

questions.question: True or False: The altar described in Ezekiel 43 has four horns on top starting from the altar upward.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:15 says the altar will have four horns from the altar and upward.

questions.question: The vision of God's glory entering the house in Ezekiel 43 echoes which earlier vision of God's presence in Ezekiel?
options: The vision at the river Chebar
The vision of the valley of dry bones
The vision of Gog and Magog
The vision of the new temple in chapter 40
questions.correctAnswer: The vision at the river Chebar
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:3 references the appearance of the vision similar to that seen by the river Chebar, where God's glory appeared.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 43 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 43 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: From which direction did the glory of the God of Israel come in Ezekiel's vision?
questions.correctAnswer: East
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:2 states the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east. This direction symbolizes the coming of divine revelation and presence, consistent with biblical themes such as the rising sun representing God's glory (Psalm 113:3, Malachi 4:2).

questions.question: What was the sound of God's voice described as in Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: Noise of many waters
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:2 describes God's voice as like the noise of many waters, signifying overwhelming power and majesty, similar to imagery in Revelation 1:15 and Psalm 93:4 where God's voice is powerful and majestic.

questions.question: What did the glory of the LORD do when it entered the house?
questions.correctAnswer: Filled the house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:5 states the glory of the LORD filled the house, signifying God's presence fully dwelling with His people, paralleling the fullness of God's presence in the Tabernacle (Exodus 40:34-35) and the New Testament teaching of God dwelling with believers (John 1:14).

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 43, what is the place where God’s throne and the soles of His feet will dwell?
options: In the midst of the children of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: In the midst of the children of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:7 reveals God’s throne and feet will dwell among the children of Israel forever, indicating God's covenant presence with His people, a theme echoed in Isaiah 66:1 and John 14:23 where God dwells with His people.

questions.question: What caused God to consume the house of Israel in anger, according to Ezekiel 43?
options: Their abominations and defilement of His holy name
questions.correctAnswer: Their abominations and defilement of His holy name
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:8 explains that Israel defiled God's name through abominations, leading to His consuming anger, consistent with the biblical principle that sin against God's holiness provokes divine judgment (Psalm 78:40-41; Romans 1:18).

questions.question: What must the house of Israel do so that God will dwell in their midst forever, as commanded in Ezekiel 43?
options: Put away their whoredom and the carcasses of their kings
questions.correctAnswer: Put away their whoredom and the carcasses of their kings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:9 instructs Israel to remove their idolatry and defilement to restore God's presence, reflecting the biblical call to holiness and repentance found in Deuteronomy 30:6 and 2 Chronicles 7:14.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Ezekiel showing the house to the house of Israel?
options: So they may be ashamed of their iniquities and keep the pattern
To encourage them to build wealth
To show them a new location
questions.correctAnswer: So they may be ashamed of their iniquities and keep the pattern
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:10 emphasizes that showing the house aims to bring awareness and repentance of sin, leading to obedience to God's laws, aligning with biblical themes of conviction and restoration (Psalm 51:3-4; Ezekiel 36:31).

questions.question: What specific instructions are given about the altar in Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: Its measurements, purging, and offerings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:13-27 provides detailed altar dimensions, purification rituals, and sacrificial offerings, reflecting God’s holiness and the need for atonement, consistent with Levitical law (Leviticus 16:29-34) and New Testament fulfillment in Christ's sacrifice (Hebrews 9:11-14).

questions.question: Who is to minister at the altar according to Ezekiel 43?
options: The Levites of the seed of Zadok
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites of the seed of Zadok
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:19 specifies that the Levites descended from Zadok who remained faithful shall serve, underscoring the importance of priestly purity and obedience, consistent with the priestly role in Exodus 28 and the New Testament priesthood of believers (1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: What is the significance of the altar horns mentioned in Ezekiel 43?
options: They are places where blood is applied for cleansing
They are decorations with no ritual purpose
They represent the four corners of the earth
They are places for incense offerings
questions.correctAnswer: They are places where blood is applied for cleansing
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:20 instructs applying blood to the four horns of the altar as part of purification, symbolizing atonement and God's acceptance of sacrifice, consistent with Leviticus 4:7 and Hebrews 9:12-14 about cleansing by the blood of sacrifice.

questions.question: How many days shall the altar be purged and the priests consecrated according to Ezekiel 43?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:26 states the altar shall be purged and priests consecrated for seven days, paralleling other biblical consecration periods such as Exodus 29:35 and Leviticus 8:33, symbolizing completeness and holiness.

questions.question: On which day after the consecration shall the priests begin making burnt offerings and peace offerings?
questions.correctAnswer: The eighth day
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:27 declares that from the eighth day forward, priests shall offer burnt and peace offerings, marking the start of regular worship after purification, echoing Leviticus 9:1-7 where offerings began on the eighth day of consecration.

questions.question: What does the detailed description of the altar and its ordinances in Ezekiel 43 emphasize about God’s nature?
options: God’s holiness and requirement for purification
questions.correctAnswer: God’s holiness and requirement for purification
questions.explanation: The detailed altar instructions (Ezekiel 43:12-27) emphasize God's holiness demanding precise rituals and purification, consistent with biblical doctrine found in Leviticus 10:3, Isaiah 6:3, and Hebrews 12:14 highlighting God's purity and justice.

questions.question: What theological theme is highlighted by God stating He will no longer allow the house of Israel to defile His holy name?
options: God’s commitment to sanctification and covenant faithfulness
questions.correctAnswer: God’s commitment to sanctification and covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:7 reveals God’s promise to no longer allow defilement, illustrating His covenant faithfulness and desire for holiness, aligning with themes in Jeremiah 31:33 and 1 Peter 1:15-16 about God’s sanctifying work.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 43 depict the role of the Spirit in revealing God’s glory and temple vision?
options: The Spirit took Ezekiel into the inner court and revealed the glory
The Spirit led Ezekiel away from the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit took Ezekiel into the inner court and revealed the glory
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 43:5 describes the Spirit uplifting Ezekiel into the inner court to witness God's glory filling the house, reflecting the Spirit’s role in divine revelation (John 16:13, Acts 2:17) and presence with God’s people.
